Coverage remained the same at 69.415% when pulling **63ef4353005e49551b5f13a9e7dc22943e9764fc on graceguo-supercat:gg-FixChartMessage** into **c9c6bcaabeab4127a601dfda69a1411d2893c1d5 on apache:master**.

How else do you want to represent a graph in a table? source->target is the proper way to model it.

Maybe you're trying to do something simpler like representing a linear funnel?

Think about it, in a Sankey data points can come in or drop out at any node, and skip step(s). A column representation of that would come short in many ways.
LGTM!
LGTM!

I've been down for some time. I checked the security key and am using same one as with 2.7. 
I upgraded to 3.6 and tried appending the sqlalchemy to this:
`SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = 'sqlite:///' + os.path.join(DATA_DIR, 'superset.db?charset=utf8')`
with no luck & I get this error message:
`2017-08-15 02:19:26,671:ERROR:flask_appbuilder.security.sqla.manager:DB Creation and initialization failed: 'charset' is an invalid keyword argument for this function`

My complete traceback below.

Any help would be appreciated!

@pityuszgege, @mistercrunch   I checked both pyhive and sqlalchemy and they both worked just fine. Here's the code I used to connect to my Spark Thrift Server. I was able to get table names and also SELECT rows from them.

**SQLAlchemy:**
```
from sqlalchemy.engine import create_engine
from sqlalchemy import text

engine = create_engine('hive://localhost:10001')
query  = text("show tables")
# query  = text("SELECT * FROM lineorder LIMIT 10")
result = engine.execute(query)
print result.fetchall()

```

**pyhive:**
```
from pyhive import hive

cursor = hive.connect(host="localhost", port=10001).cursor()
cursor.execute('show tables')
# cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM lineorder LIMIT 10')
print cursor.fetchall()
```

According to my Issue #3263 , I think the problem is the schema. Spark SQL temp tables don't have schema/database, but SQL Lab only tries to fetch tables from selected schema.

Trop fort! Merci!

Authentication is a web framework-related feature and I'd prefer for the work to take place within FAB. I'm a maintainer of FAB (I obtained write access on the repository after many contributions) so I can help on that side.

At Airbnb we login against LDAP using AUTH_REMOTE_USER. We have a nginx reverse proxy that takes care of authenticating against LDAP and add headers that Superset can pick up. We use this service for countless internal apps. It's nice since it works with apps written in all languages.

On the login event we simply create new users on the fly. It's not too hard to setup a script that will create/maintain roles dynamically/periodically in Superset either.

Better LDAP support would be nice though.

https://gist.github.com/mistercrunch/6d31af4a11c47edcedc1ba6ceb5f5fab
LGTM

So we want the web server(s) to be stateless (Superset isn't a database!), that probably means that at each web request `PandasConnector` would have to read the raw data, filter/aggregate/compute, and flush the results so they can be garbage collected. 

Seems pretty inefficient, why not flush your dataframe to a proper sql-speaking database an using the sqla connector. 

An Apache Arrow connector seems like a more sensical idea though I'm unclear on the specifics.

It's not too hard to customize the authentication in FAB. Here's an example of what we do at Airbnb. You can create and assign roles when user first login.
https://gist.github.com/mistercrunch/6d31af4a11c47edcedc1ba6ceb5f5fab
Does that datasource have segments?
I am facing the same issue #3260.
why not try to delete "static"  in the setup.py. change PACKAGE_DIR = os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'superset','static', 'assets') as PACKAGE_DIR = os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'superset', 'assets')
What's latest version? Please use a release or a git hash
static/assets is a link to assets. Are you on windows?

It's 0.18.2
Thanks.
i am on ubuntu14.04,the link can not work
Then 0.18.2 is not the latest version as now.
So, should i test it on the latest one first?
im wrong,when i delete the static,i can compile it. but ,superset can not running . some file depend on it
It's better to report bugs againt latest release or latest master because they can be already be fixed.
Thanks, i'll verify this issue on the latest release.

In dev mode, the `manifest.json` changes but will not be reloaded after js files changing, so the pages remain the same. Utilizing webpack chunkhash depending on the NODE_ENV will be prefered. Like this:

```
process.env.NODE_ENV === 'dev' ? '[name].entry.js' : '[name].[chunkhash].entry.js'
```
